sentences.sContent: Check the tiles carefully before you buy them.
sentences.sCn: 购买之前要把瓷砖仔细检查一下。

sentences.sContent: A first rule in solving any mystery is to check the facts.
sentences.sCn: 揭开谜团的第一条规则是核查事实。

sentences.sContent: Fill in the cash book carefully and always check your calculations.
sentences.sCn: 仔细填写现金账簿，每次都要检查计算结果。

sentences.sContent: Positive test results are double-checked (= looked at twice ) to make absolutely sure.
sentences.sCn: 对呈阳性的化验结果要进行复查，以确保绝对准确。

sentences.sContent: ...White-collar workers check email round the clock because it is required by their employers...
...We check email at all hours of the day--we're obsessed...
...someone takes out their phone to check who knows what...
...I have to check them and organize a presentation...
...and 60% use their smartphones to check in with work outside of normal working hours...
...Finally，when the passage is read for the third time，you should check what you have written...
...we can check that on the passenger list...
...Being able to check in with a child anytime goes a long way toward relieving parental anxiety and may help parents loosen their control a little sooner...
...you should check what you have written...

words.tran: 检验员；收银员；棋子；方格图案；制止者
检查（check的过去式和过去分词）
把…画成棋盘形方格图案；使多样化

trans.tranOther: to do something in order to find out whether something really is correct, true, or in good condition
